huntBios.GENERAL_INFORMATION: There is a growing population of deer inhabiting not only the farmlands, but the neighborhoods in the communities of Helper, Kenilworth, Spring Glen, Carbonville, Price, and Wellington.  This hunt is intended to help control this population in a manner that is safe while providing hunter opportunity.
huntBios.SAFETY_CONS: You will be hunting in close proximity to people's homes.  Please be very certain of your target and what is behind it.  It would be wise to not only secure permission from the property owner you would like to hunt on but also on surrounding property owners in the event that the deer wanders on to neighboring properties.  Please be very aware that not every property owner has the same opinion on hunting.  It would be advisable to hunt in a manner that will not attract attention to yourself as to minimize any negative public perceptions that could occur with wounded animals, gutpiles in people's yards etc.
huntBios.WEATHER_CONS: It is hot in August and September.  Be prepared to harvest your animal quickly and efficiently, and get it field dressed, skinned, and cooled off as quick as possible in order to avoid the possibility of spoilage.  Meat will spoil very quickly if not cooled off immediately.
huntBios.MANAGEMENT_OBJ: 80~~~~~~~~~~~~For more detailed information on population and objective data please see the Big Game Annual Report Page.
huntBios.BIOLOGIST_NOTES: Deer are spread out fairly uniformly across the hunt boundary.  There are farm fields surrounding each of the towns that hold deer as well as localized neighborhoods that hold small populations.  Orchards are also a good place to look.  You must secure permission from private landowners prior to hunting on this unit.

huntMaster.PRINT_HUNT_NAME: Nine Mile, Price River Valley - Hunt #DA1030
huntMaster.NOTES:
Please be aware that the DWR may be conducting aerial surveys or big game captures during the season dates of this hunt.
Baiting big game for the purposes of hunting is now illegal in Utah.
Click here for more information.

The use of all trail cameras (including both non-handheld transmitting and non-transmitting devices) in the harvest or to aid in the harvest of big game is prohibited between July 31 and Dec. 31. Click here for more information.
huntMaster.HARVEST_REPORTING: Voluntary: Hunters who obtain this permit are encouraged, but not required, to submit a harvest report. Report your harvest online or by calling 1-800-221-0659.

huntBoundaryInfos.LAND_OWNERSHIP: The areas where deer live on this unit is virtually all privately owned.  Please secure written permission from the private landowner and likely several of the neighboring landowners prior to hunting.
huntBoundaryInfos.CAMPGRND_INFO: There are motels in Price.  There are several RV parks in the Price area.  Dispersed camping is allowed on BLM lands on the outskirts of these communities.
huntBoundaryInfos.PRIM_ACCESS_PTS: This hunt boundary is intended to promote hunting in or near towns to thin herds of urban deer and reduce depredation.  Some common access points to areas with farmlands include the Coal Creek Loop Road in Wellington, the Old Wellington Road, Airport Road in Price, Ridge Road south of Price, Carbonville Road, and the road connecting Spring Glen and Kenilworth.
huntBoundaryInfos.SUGGESTED_MAPS: USGS 1:100,000 map :  Price.  You can also go to the Carbon County Utah GIS website at www.carbon.utah.gov/services/gis to look up private property ownership
huntBoundaryInfos.COUNTY_ROAD_INFO: Main arteries are county and city owned and maintained.  Most smaller roads are privately owned.  Please secure permission prior to trespassing on private lands.
huntBoundaryInfos.ATV_VEH_ACCESS: ATV access is at the Private landowner's discretion
huntBoundaryInfos.PRIV_TRIBE_LAND_ISSUES: This unit is all private land.  You must have written permission from the landowner prior to hunting.  It is advisable to seek permission from several surrounding landowners prior to hunting in the event that the deer leaves the property after being shot.
huntBoundaryInfos.BOUNDARY_DESCRIPTION: Carbon County--Boundary begins at Ridge Road and SR-10; north along SR-10 to the Carbon Canal; west and north along the Carbon Canal to SR-6; northwest along SR-6 to Hill Street near Helper; north along Hill Street to Vernal Street; north along Vernal Street to Canyon Street; west on Canyon Street to the Utah Railroad bridge/tracks in Spring Canyon; east and north along the Railroad tracks to the Denver-Rio Grande Railroad tracks near the Port of Entry;  southeast along these tracks to the old Kenilworth Railroad near Railroad Avenue in Helper; southeast along this grade to Claybanks Road; south along the Claybanks Road to the Price-Kenilworth Road; south along the Price-Kenilworth Road to 1900 East in Price; south along 1900 East to Airport Road; east along Airport Road to the Carbon Animal Shelter; at the Carbon Animal Shelter take the dirt road southeast to North Coal Creek Road; east along North Coal Creek Road to East Coal Creek Road; south along East Coal Creek Road across US-6 to Ridge Road; west along Ridge Road to SR-10. Maps:  Price.  Contact the Southeast Region Office for questions (435) 613-3700
